newsitem.title: USA: Bank debt unmoved by positive earnings reports.
newsitem.headline: Bank debt unmoved by positive earnings reports.

text.p: Bank debt failed to budge on Monday despite reports of positive fourth quarter earnings for a few banks, corporate bond traders said.

On Monday, NationsBank Corp reported a 24 percent increase in fourth quarter earnings to $2.19 per share versus $1.87 while Barnett Banks said fourth quarter earnings rose 13 percent to $0.76 per share versus $0.67.
"There was really very little movement in the paper," one high-grade trader said. "Both earnings came in very much as expected."
NationsBank earnings received a boost from bond trading and investment banking results.
The bank completed its acquisition of Boatmen's Bancshares Inc of St. Louis, a move that lifted the bank from its ranking of fifth largest bank in the U.S., to fourth place.
Barnett, which sold $776 million of non-core credit card loans to Household International Inc during the quarter, saw its fourth quarter credit card charge-offs fall sharply as a result.
Barnett Banks' stock ended the trading day up 1/4 at 40-7/8 while NationsBank stock closed off 1/8 at 102-7/8.
